intro: Stachytarpheta peruviana, commonly known as the purpletop verbena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its striking violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its showy blooms attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological diversity.
